intro: Sida lasiostega, commonly known as rough sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Sida lasiostega is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties are not extensively studied.
